form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the processes to approve programs of education for purposes of the educational assistance programs of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans Education Transparency and Training Act or the VETT Act.

section.header: Processes to approve programs of education for purposes of the educational assistance programs of the Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.header: Limitation of disapproval of programs of education for failure To provide certain forms
subsection.text: Section 3679(f)(5) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking this paragraph and inserting this subparagraph;
in subparagraph (B), by striking this paragraph and inserting subparagraph (A); and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: If an educational institution cannot provide to an individual a form under paragraph (1) that contains all of the information required under subparagraph (A) of such paragraph, the educational institution shall provide to such individual, with the form under such paragraph, a notice—

clause.text: that specifies what such information may be inaccurate or incomplete; and
that includes, in place of the information that may be inaccurate or incomplete, the best estimate available on the date of such notice.

subsection.header: Publication of information about training for school certifying officials
subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall establish a website to serve as a central location for the publication of information about the training that the Department of Veterans Affairs provides for school certifying officials and shall update such information on a regular basis.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives April 9, 2025.
